headline: AT&T to Buy Lumen’s Mass Markets Fiber Business for $5.75 Billion
summary: AT&T will buy substantially all of Lumen’s mass markets fiber business for $5.75 billion in a move it says will accelerate high-speed fiber internet access for millions of Americans.

raw.headline: AT&T to Buy Lumen’s Mass Markets Fiber Business for $5.75 Billion
raw.summary: AT&T will buy substantially all of Lumen’s mass markets fiber business for $5.75 billion in a move it says will accelerate high-speed fiber internet access for millions of Americans.

headline: Lumen shares surge as AT&T inks $5.75B fiber network deal
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Lumen Technologies Inc (NYSE:LUMN) rose 15.5% on Wednesday after AT&T Inc (NYSE:T) announced a $5.75 billion acquisition of a significant portion of Lumen’s Mass Markets fiber business. AT&T stock gained 0.2% following the news, as the company secured market share.

raw.headline: Lumen shares surge as AT&T inks $5.75B fiber network deal
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Lumen Technologies Inc (NYSE:LUMN) rose 15.5% on Wednesday after AT&T Inc (NYSE:T) announced a $5.75 billion acquisition of a significant portion of Lumen’s Mass Markets fiber business. AT&T stock gained 0.2% following the news, as the company secured market share.

headline: AT&T agrees to buy Lumen's consumer fiber business for $5.75 billion in cash
summary: (Reuters) -AT&T has clinched a deal to acquire Lumen Technologies' consumer fiber operations for $5.75 billion in cash, the companies said on Wednesday, as the wireless provider adds further scale to its national fiber footprint.  Buying the unit will gain AT&T 1 million fiber customers, as well as significantly expand its fiber-network operations in Denver, Las Vegas, Minneapolis-St. Paul, Orlando, Phoenix, Portland, Salt Lake City and Seattle, according to an AT&T statement.  The sale of its consumer fiber assets, first reported by Reuters, allows Lumen to focus on growing the company's enterprise fiber business, Chris Stansbury, Chief Financial Officer of Lumen, told Reuters in an interview.

raw.headline: AT&T agrees to buy Lumen's consumer fiber business for $5.75 billion in cash
raw.summary: (Reuters) -AT&T has clinched a deal to acquire Lumen Technologies' consumer fiber operations for $5.75 billion in cash, the companies said on Wednesday, as the wireless provider adds further scale to its national fiber footprint.  Buying the unit will gain AT&T 1 million fiber customers, as well as significantly expand its fiber-network operations in Denver, Las Vegas, Minneapolis-St. Paul, Orlando, Phoenix, Portland, Salt Lake City and Seattle, according to an AT&T statement.  The sale of its consumer fiber assets, first reported by Reuters, allows Lumen to focus on growing the company's enterprise fiber business, Chris Stansbury, Chief Financial Officer of Lumen, told Reuters in an interview.

headline: AT&T to Buy Lumen’s Fiber Business for $5.75 Billion
summary: AT&T  has agreed to acquire substantially all of  Lumen’s  residential fiber broadband network for about $5.75 billion in an all-cash deal.  Lumen’s Mass Markets fiber business includes about one million fiber customers, including residential and business customers, and reaches more than four million fiber locations across 11 states.  The transaction, subject to regulatory approval, is expected to close in the first half of 2026.

The transaction, subject to regulatory approval, is expected to close in the first half of 2026.

headline: Q1 Earnings Highs And Lows: WideOpenWest (NYSE:WOW) Vs The Rest Of The Wireless, Cable and Satellite Stocks
summary: The end of an earnings season can be a great time to discover new stocks and assess how companies are handling the current business environment. Let’s take a look at how WideOpenWest (NYSE:WOW) and the rest of the wireless, cable and satellite stocks fared in Q1.
